scenarios.text: You're planning a trip together. How do you decide on the length of your stay?

options.text: Let's pick whatever number of days makes us both feel relaxed and connected.
I'll run the costs and schedules to choose the most efficient trip length.
Let's go as long as our schedules allow—more days means more chances for spontaneous adventures.

scenarios.text: Time to choose your destination. What drives your decision?

options.text: If London makes you happier, I'm good with it.
Cost, flights, and attractions favor Paris—let's choose that.
London vibe calls to me—let's chase that spontaneity.

scenarios.text: You're going to London! But your partner's flight gets delayed by 6 hours. What's your move?

options.text: I'll cancel and rebook so we arrive together.
I'll compare rebooking fees; if too high, I'll go ahead.
This is great—more time to explore solo.

scenarios.text: You're heading to Paris! But your partner's flight gets delayed by 6 hours. What's your move?

options.text: I'll cancel and rebook so we arrive together.
I'll compare rebooking fees; if too high, I'll go ahead.
This is great—more time to explore solo.

scenarios.text: You're waiting at an airport hotel. Your partner hasn't responded to texts in 3 hours. Your thoughts?

options.text: Please let me know you're okay—I'm really worried.
They're probably tied up with work.
I'll explore the nearby café and take photos.

scenarios.text: You have a solo day in the city while waiting. How do you spend it?

options.text: I'll visit that café we wanted—and send photos.
Let's stick to the planned tour.
I'll walk around and explore the neighborhood.

scenarios.text: You spot an amazing street artist performing, but your phone battery is at 5%. What do you do?

options.text: Put phone away and enjoy the moment.
Take one quick photo, then save battery.
Let battery die to capture this.
